TopicTitle: [1.12.x] Tarsier Space Technology with Galaxies (V7.13) 12th Sep 2021

Articles.Content:
Where are the pieces on the tech tree? I can't find them... I have research bodies installed v1.9.3 (from ckan) and maybe they're conflicting.

Edited August 4, 2017 by occ

4 hours ago, occ said:

Where are the pieces on the tech tree? I can't find them... I have research bodies installed v1.9.3 (from ckan) and maybe they're conflicting.

Maybe .. who knows. No Logs = No support.
Without a log and more than one line it's anyone's guess.

V7.0 published.

Fixes the celestial body lists in the UI for the telescopes (to select target).
Also updates in flight when contracts are accepted in flight (using a mod).

Why are the planets I look at with my telescope pitch black, even when I should be looking at the day side of them? 

 

EDIT: Turns out the cause was a cloud mod, This one specifically, how can I properly run this mod while still being able to actually see the planets from this range?

Edited August 13, 2017 by Pigbear2
I do not have any graphical mods installed.

On 8/6/2017 at 6:02 AM, JPLRepo said:

V7.0 published.

Fixes the celestial body lists in the UI for the telescopes (to select target).
Also updates in flight when contracts are accepted in flight (using a mod).

Now, I've just encountered a weird variation on the celestial body list bug. Nothing game breaking, but I thought I'd better let you know.

I just upgraded to 1.3 yesterday, and so far everything seems to be working... and in a sandbox game my telescopes work fine.

However, in my Emiko career game, the telescopes still only see planets, no moons or galaxies. It's not really a huge deal, I can still use it for what I need (like looking at Emiko Asteroid up close from a ship that's over 2km away... ) and I don't need the science points in that particular career game.

But still I thought you'd want to know. If you need my logs or the game file or whatever, let me know.

I can see the arm of the chemcam, but that's about it. Your eyes are better than mine. And I'm not even sure what the problem is.

I apologize for the lack of clarity but yes, when ChemCam is active the terrain of minmus appears to be doubled and offset perpendicular to the ground. On Kerbin the only noticable change when the camera is deployed is the sky getting brighter.

 

12 hours ago, JPLRepo said:

oh good eyes.
Hmm. Well without logs and reproduction steps I don't have the time to investigate unfortunately.

Where are the logs stored? The game does not crash so there are no crash logs and the in game logs do not record anything. To reproduce I attached a ChemCam to a stock heavy lander, teleported to Minmus, landed on a flat and deployed the camera. This is on a default installation with only this mod.

Edited August 27, 2017 by Gyger
Additional information

18 hours ago, Gyger said:

Where are the logs stored? The game does not crash so there are no crash logs and the in game logs do not record anything. To reproduce I attached a ChemCam to a stock heavy lander, teleported to Minmus, landed on a flat and deployed the camera. This is on a default installation with only this mod.

Read the post two above yours.  The locations are mentioned in that thread.

KSP creates a log file, called output_log.txt regardless of the crash status and it's located in a directory in your KSP game folder. The game and various mods write to the file as necessary to help with performance issues and problem diagnosis.  It's not perfect but it can provide clues.

Edited August 28, 2017 by Brigadier

I got my scope up in orbit and the first thing R&D sends me is a contract for my telescope which I found very 'Kerbal'. I was wondering if it's something you might have a solution to avoid it coming up again? I'm assuming the contract was part of this pack, so sorry if it's not.

The Contract was to take of photo of "the Sun". Needless to say I didn't take it as the rewards weren't enough for blowing the optics and replacing the telescope.

Typical Kerbal R&D nutters.

I got my scope up in orbit and the first thing R&D sends me is a contract for my telescope which I found very 'Kerbal'. I was wondering if it's something you might have a solution to avoid it coming up again? I'm assuming the contract was part of this pack, so sorry if it's not.

The Contract was to take of photo of "the Sun". Needless to say I didn't take it as the rewards weren't enough for blowing the optics and replacing the telescope.

What?

Taking a photo of the sun will not blow up the optics and need replacement of your telescope?

Think you are mixing your mods up.

2 minutes ago, JPLRepo said:

What?

Taking a photo of the sun will not blow up the optics and need replacement of your telescope?

Think you are mixing your mods up.

Ah - yep sorry, I did try Cactus in the past, but settled on TST. I still got the contract, but had assumed the effects of the other mod.

TST seems to not play nice with 1.3.1.  I have lots of other mods though so I am not sure if it is just some combination or not.  But I add it and the game will not start, I remove it and it will.

Are any of you having the same issue or should I be getting logs and what not?

1 hour ago, Leszek said:

TST seems to not play nice with 1.3.1.  I have lots of other mods though so I am not sure if it is just some combination or not.  But I add it and the game will not start, I remove it and it will.

Are any of you having the same issue or should I be getting logs and what not?

Correct. Seeing how it hasn't been updated for 1.3.1 I wouldn't expect it to.

1 minute ago, JPLRepo said:

Correct. Seeing how it hasn't been updated for 1.3.1 I wouldn't expect it to.

OK so it is not just me.  Good to know.

Not sure if I am reading a bit into that answer but lots of mods work in 1.3.1 that are for 1.3 and I can't know if it is the 1.3.1 update by itself, or if this mod and another and the update is the cause, or if I made some mistake in copying files from Steam over top of my 1.3 without deleting my 1.3 first.  ETC...  If I was the only one with the issue then it changes what I need to do to get it fixed.  Since it seems I am not the only one then I don't need to worry about troubleshooting it. 

I was not being dense.  And the only reason why I cared enough to even ask is because this is one of those mods that I really like and I think are really great.  Hence I didn't just start a new game without it.

 

And I am sorry if it came off as me being dense.
V7.1 released for KSP 1.3.1
Awesomeness.  You are the best.  Thank you.

On 1/11/2017 at 2:34 PM, JPLRepo said:

Whilst I agree CKAN is a great mod for those that can't use Zip tools. I take no part, nor am I interested in maintaining the CKAN mod metadata for my mods.
Please don't ask me about it but refer to the CKAN mod thread if you are having issues with CKAN or the metadata it maintains.

 

JPLRepo,

What Zip tools do you use or are your referring to in your post? I've only heard of CKAN that works seamlessly with KSP. I've been asking around recently because a minority of mod authors that I typically downloaded from over the years suddenly went against the application (suddenly because I've been lackluster in forum observations). What would your recommendations be for a replacement and what methods do you use? I'm merely asking because some event must of happened while I was in other life ventures that I entirely missed.

Thanks!

I use 7 Zip.
